], has played a role in the identification of the Poisson boundary for
many classes of groups, some of which we mention below.
The Poisson boundary has been described for several families of countable groups, many
of which possess hyperbolic-like properties. One such family is that of non-abelian free
groups, whose Poisson boundary was described in [
] for measures supported on a free
] for finitary measures. More generally, the Poisson boundary
of a (non-elementary) hyperbolic group was shown to coincide with its Gromov boundary
